verses.text: Then I turned, and lift up mine eyes, and looked, and behold, a flying roll.
And he said unto me, What seest thou? And I answered, I see a flying roll; the length thereof \add is\add* twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof ten cubits.

Then said he unto me, This \add is\add* the curse that goeth forth over the face of the whole earth: For every one that stealeth shall be cut off \add as\add* on this \add side\add* according to it; And every one that sweareth shall be cut off \add as\add* on that \add side\add* according to it.

I will bring it forth, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, And it shall enter into the house of the thief, And into the house of him that sweareth falsely by my name: And it shall remain in the midst of his house, And shall consume it with the timber thereof and the stones thereof.
Then the angel that talked with me went forth, and said unto me, Lift up now thine eyes, and see what \add is\add* this that goeth forth.
And I said, What \add is\add* it? And he said, This \add is\add* an ephah that goeth forth. He said moreover, This \add is\add* their resemblance through all the earth.
And behold, there \add was\add* lift up a talent of lead: and this \add is\add* a woman that sitteth in the midst of the ephah.
And he said, This \add is\add* wickedness. And he cast it into the midst of the ephah; and he cast the weight of lead upon the mouth thereof.

Then lift I up mine eyes, and looked, and behold, there came out two women, and the wind \add was\add* in their wings; for they had wings like the wings of a stork: and they lift up the ephah between the earth and the heaven.
Then said I to the angel that talked with me, Whither do these bear the ephah?
And he said unto me, To build it a house in the land of Shinar: and it shall be established, and set there upon her own base.
